# hidesScaleName

**Instance Property**

The visibility of the unit name of a temperature.

## Declaration

```swift
var hidesScaleName: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

Set `hidesScaleName` to `true` to exclude the unit name from a formatted temperature string. For example, `90°` rather than `90°F` or `90°C` with the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Measurement/FormatStyle/UnitWidth/narrow] unit width, or `90 degrees` rather than `90 degrees Celcius` or `90 degrees Fahrenheit` with the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Measurement/FormatStyle/UnitWidth/wide] width.

Hiding the unit name only affects the presentation of the measurement. Unless you specify `asProvided` as the `usage`, the system converts the temperature to the unit that the locale uses.

## Modifying a measurement format style

- **width**: The width of the measurement unit.
- **Measurement.FormatStyle.UnitWidth**: Specifies the width of the unit, determining the textual representation.
- **numberFormatStyle**: The formatting of the measurement value.
- **usage**: The intended purpose of the formatted measurement.
- **locale**: The locale of the format style.
